docs.snippet: A human rights committee from the Organization of American States called today on the Chilean military Government to ban the application of physical and psychological pressure on detainees.
docs.lead_paragraph: A human rights committee from the Organization of American States called today on the Chilean military Government to ban the application of physical and psychological pressure on detainees.
docs.abstract: OAS Inter-Amer Com on Human Rights calls on Chilean mil Govt to ban application of physical and psychological pressure on detainees, press statement at end of 15-day investigation into alleged violations of human rights in Chile; urges that prisoners not be compelled to do forced labor or be held incommunicado and that minors be separated from adults in places of detention; com members noted (S)

headline.main: Inter-American Unit Bids Chile Improve Conditions of Detention

docs.lead_paragraph: Torture has now become a state institution in more than 30 countries, a rule of pain carried out by technicians, scientists, paramilitary officials, judges and cabinet ministers. Documentation comes from the respected human fights agency Amnesty International, a private London-based group that seeks freedom for political prisoners and has offices in 32 nations. headline.main: Torture, an Official Way of Life in 30 Countries; Nations Are Now Exchanging Expertise and Equipment

docs.snippet: Official sources said today that a meningitis epidemic that had caused at least 360 deaths in the SAo Paulo area since July 1 was spreading. The Ministry of Health in Brasilia declined today to give a total death toll but reports from Sdo Paulo said...
docs.lead_paragraph: Official sources said today that a meningitis epidemic that had caused at least 360 deaths in the SAo Paulo area since July 1 was spreading. The Ministry of Health in Brasilia declined today to give a total death toll but reports from Sdo Paulo said that about 500 persons had died of 'the disease around the country.
docs.abstract: Brasilia Health Min Paulo de Almeida Machado repts that meningitis epidemic that caused at least 360 deaths in Sao Paulo area since July is spreading to other southern states; declines to give total death toll but repts estimate that 500 people have died; meets with health officials of 4 southern states as well as from central state of Goias and Brasilia (S)

headline.main: 'BRAZIL REPORTS MENINGITIS RISE; Death Toll Around Country Is Estimated at 500

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A world fragmented by differences in race, religion and social and economic conditions is at last taking cognizance of one of its most fundamental common problems: population.
docs.lead_paragraph: A world fragmented by differences in race, religion and social and economic conditions is at last taking cognizance of one of its most fundamental common problems: population.
docs.abstract: NY Times series examining world food situation assesses impact of population boom on world food supply; notes that experts contend that earth's surface has potential of producing adequate nutrition for far more people than there are now, but realization of that potential seems further away than are additional billions of hungry people; holds that in recent yrs soc and econ pressures nave impelled many nations to institute fertility-reduction programs, usually under title of 'family planning'; contends that any worldwide effort to slow 'humanity's proliferation' is so controversial that govt leaders ignored problem until recently; notes that 1st global population conf at govt levels will be held in Bucharest, Aug 19-30; points out that conf hopes for consensus on problems of unbridled population growth, recognition of manifold options for mitigating those threats and agreement on remedial efforts; notes that unless current 2% yearly population growth is reduced, population in next 35 yrs is expected to double; maintains that unless supportive elements of meager standards of living are augmented, living standards will decline, aggravating deprivation, discontent and disorder; finds that slowed population growth and socio-econ betterment are interacting and that both objectives must be pursued simultaneously; illus; graph traces population explosion from 1830 to 2000 (L)

headline.main: Population BoomandFood Shortage: WorldLosing Fight for Vital Balance; The Trend of Growth

docs.snippet: Promising a "government of peace and development," President Alfonso Lopez Michelsen has launched in Colombia an experiment of great importance for Latin America. It is especially important because Colombia is a nation that has 'practiced democracy...
docs.lead_paragraph: Promising a "government of peace and development," President Alfonso Lopez Michelsen has launched in Colombia an experiment of great importance for Latin America. It is especially important because Colombia is a nation that has 'practiced democracy since 1958, one whose new President was freely elected in a landslide with large majorities in both houses of Congresss .
docs.abstract: ed, noting unexpectedly large majority votes to moderate candidates in Colombia and Venezuela, holds both countries have opportunity to demonstrate that impressive growth and reform are possible under freedom and democracy; says that while there are mil dictatorships in most Latin Amer countries, elections provide fresh proof that dem govt can survive in developing country beset by usual problems of unemployment and inflation

docs.lead_paragraph: Lin Wen-Hsiung, pitched a two-hitter and hit two home runs today in lead ing Kao Hsiung of Taiwan, to a 12-1 victory over Red Bluff, Calif. and the Little League World Series champion ship. It was the fourth straight year that a Taiwan teamhas won the tournament and the fifth time in six years.
